segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to delete an AppLocker rule.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to delete an AppLocker rule.

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to delete an AppLocker rule.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to delete an AppLocker rule.

segment.source: As older apps are retired and new apps are deployed in your organization, it will be necessary to modify the application control policies.
segment.target: As older apps are retired and new apps are deployed in your organization, it will be necessary to modify the application control policies.

segment.source: If an app becomes unsupported by the IT department or is no longer allowed due to the organization's security policy, then deleting the rule or rules associated with that app will prevent the app from running.
segment.target: If an app becomes unsupported by the IT department or is no longer allowed due to the organization's security policy, then deleting the rule or rules associated with that app will prevent the app from running.

segment.source: For info about testing an AppLocker policy to see what rules affect which files or applications, see Test an AppLocker policy by Using Test-AppLockerPolicy.
segment.target: For info about testing an AppLocker policy to see what rules affect which files or applications, see Test an AppLocker policy by Using Test-AppLockerPolicy.

segment.source: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.
segment.target: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.

segment.source: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.
segment.target: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.

segment.source: To delete a rule in an AppLocker policy
segment.target: To delete a rule in an AppLocker policy

segment.source: Click the appropriate rule collection for which you want to delete the rule.
segment.target: Click the appropriate rule collection for which you want to delete the rule.

segment.source: In the details pane, right-click the rule to delete, click Delete, and then click Yes.
segment.target: In the details pane, right-click the rule to delete, click Delete, and then click Yes.

segment.source: Note: When using Group Policy, for the rule deletion to take effect on computers within the domain, the GPO must be distributed or refreshed.
segment.target: Note: When using Group Policy, for the rule deletion to take effect on computers within the domain, the GPO must be distributed or refreshed.

segment.source: When this procedure is performed on the local device, the AppLocker policy takes effect immediately.
segment.target: When this procedure is performed on the local device, the AppLocker policy takes effect immediately.
